Below you will find instructions for subtracting numbers using

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: "Addition" is a mathematical operation. It is an action that is performed with 2 or more numbers. It allows you to find the sum between those numbers.
Use the plus (+) button to express the addition operation in the JPS Calculator app.
With the addition process, you take a number and increase it to a larger number.
Below you will find instructions for adding numbers using the JPS Calculator app.

section.p: To successfully add numbers, you must know what addition is. Refer to What is Addition? (on page ) to learn about addition.
The result from the addition is displayed.
You want to add 2 to 3. The equation is 3 + 2 = 5.

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: "Subtraction" is a mathematical operation. It is an action that is performed using 2 numbers. It allows you to find the difference between those 2 numbers.
Use the minus (-) button to express the subtraction operation in the JPS Calculator app.
With the subtraction process, you take a number away from another number and reduce it to a smaller number.
Below you will find instructions for subtracting numbers using JPS Calculator app.

section.p: To successfully subtract numbers, you must know what subtraction is. Refer to What is Subtraction? (on page ) to learn about subtraction.
The result from the subtraction is displayed.
You want to subtract 2 from 3. The equation is 3 - 2 = 1.

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: "Multiplication" is a mathematical operation. It is an action that is performed using 2 or more numbers called factors. The result is called the product.
Multiplication is repeated addition. 3 + 3 + 3 = 9 in multiplication is represented as 3 x 3 = 9. Each number 3 is a factor and the result, or product is 9.
Use the multiplication (x) button to express the multiplication operation in the JPS Calculator app.
With the multiplication process, you take 2 numbers and increase it to a larger number.
Below you will find instructions for multiplying 2 numbers using the JPS Calculator app.

section.p: To successfully add numbers, you must know what multiplication is.Refer to What is Multiplication? (on page ) to learn about multiplication.
The result (product) from the multiplication is displayed.
You want to multiply 3 and 2. The equation is 3 x 2 = 6.

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: "Division" is a mathematical operation. It is the opposite of multiplication. The parts in a division equation have special names as follows:

ul.li: Dividend: The number that is being divided
Divisor: The number by which the dividend is being divided
Quotient: The quotient is the result obtained in the division process
Remainder: Sometimes numbers cannot be divided exactly and there may be a leftover number called the remainder

div.p: Consider the simple division equation 8 2 = 4. 8 is the dividend, 2 is the divisor, and 4 is the quotient (there is no remainder).
Use the division () button to express the multiplication operation in the JPS Calculator app.
With the division process, you divide a number into groups.
Below you will find instructions for dividing 2 numbers using the JPS Calculator app.

section.p: To successfully divide numbers, you must know what division is. Refer to What is Division? (on page ) to learn about division.
The result from the division is displayed.
You want to divide 6 by 2. The equation is 6 2 = 3.
